Boeing 747 Pilots Blinded by Smoke

On the 3rd of September 2010, a Boeing 747 Freighter with call sign UPS 6 took off from Dubai International airport with destination Cologne Bonn In Germany. Soon after departure, an uncontrolled inflight fire broke out.  How the fire started and what happened after, is covered in this full length video from Mentour Pilot on YouTube, that can be accessed by this link: Mentour Pilot - Boeing 747 Pilots Blinded by Smoke

The video in the player above has been edited down from the original 36 minutes Mentour Pilot video to roughly 7 minutes, in order to focus on the effects Smoke in the Cockpit had on this accident. We encourage anyone who wants to learn about the full impact of factors that contributed to this accident to watch the full version.

Since the UPS 6 accident, UPS has become one of the strongest advocates of the EVAS system and is a leader in promoting safety measures in both the Air Cargo Industry and in aviation as a whole.

Thanks to Petter from Mentour Pilot for his advocacy in aviation safety, and for allowing us to provide this edited version of his video.
